html:
On July 31, WIRED’s global editorial director discusses the world of wellness—and beyond—with WIRED reporters.

What does it mean to be healthy in 2025? Bryan Johnson, an entrepreneur and venture capitalist who’s well known for his extreme attempts to slow the aging process, thinks he knows the answer. Does Johnson really have the healthiest body on Earth, as he claims? Will he achieve immortality through AI? Recently, WIRED global editorial director Katie Drummond visited Johnson’s home in California to sit down with him for WIRED's special Beyond Wellness edition.

This wide-ranging interview is a must-read as well as must-watch. Johnson shared his daily protocol—and much more—during the pair’s 90-minute conversation. As soon as I finished reading the piece, I had so many questions about what Johnson was like to meet in-person, and what Drummond thought about the whole experience. And hearing from our readers, many of you wanted to know more as well!

That’s why we’re excited to announce that our next subscriber-only livestream will be focused on answering your questions about the future of health and wellness. Join WIRED on Thursday, July 31, at 1:30 pm ET / 10:30 am PT to hear directly from Drummond about her conversation. She'll be joined by WIRED biotech writer Emily Mullin, who’s been closely following computer-brain interface companies like Neuralink. The event will be moderated by me, Reece Rogers.

My favorite part of these livestreams is directly interacting with WIRED readers. So, if you have any questions ahead of the event, please leave them in the comments below! We’ll see you right here, on the WIRED website, live on Thursday.
